li.The minor is not open to psychology majo: The minor is not open to psychology majors.

courseSection0.text: The minor is not open to psychology majors.

p.The Psychology Minor permits emphasis of: The Psychology Minor permits emphasis of several areas; Clinical Psychology, Human Factors Psychology, and Industrial/Organizational Psychology. When designing a minor, select courses which strengthen graduate school preparation and/or employment potential. Emphasis areas will not appear on the transcript.

li.A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.Students must maintain a minimum GPA of: Students must maintain a minimum GPA of "C" (2.0) in the minor.
li.At least 12 hours used in the minor must: At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the Psychology Department.
li.Students must satisfy each course's prer: Students must satisfy each course's prerequisites before enrolling in the class.

courseSection0.text:
The Psychology Minor permits emphasis of several areas; Clinical Psychology, Human Factors Psychology, and Industrial/Organizational Psychology. When designing a minor, select courses which strengthen graduate school preparation and/or employment potential. Emphasis areas will not appear on the transcript.
Minor Requirements
A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
Students must maintain a minimum GPA of "C" (2.0) in the minor.
At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the Psychology Department.
Prerequisite Courses
Students must satisfy each course's prerequisites before enrolling in the class.

courseSection0.text0:
Complete the following: 
PSY2012 - General Psychology (3)
PSY3204C - Statistical Methods in Psychology (4)
courseSection0.text1:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
STA2014 - Principles of Statistics (3)
STA2023 - Statistical Methods I (3)

courseSection1.text0:
Experimental
EXP3204 - Sensation and Perception (3)
EXP3404 - Basic Learning Processes (3)
EXP3604 - Cognitive Psychology (3)
EXP3640 - Psychology of Language (3)
PSB4240 - Neuropsychology (3)
courseSection1.text1:
Personality/Social
PPE3003 - Personality Theory and Research (3)
SOP3004 - Social Psychology (3)
courseSection1.text2:
Developmental
DEP2004 - Developmental Psychology (3)
DEP3464 - Psychology of Aging (3)
courseSection1.text3:
Diversity
Additional courses may be added as approved.
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
CLP3184 - Women's Mental Health (3)
SOP3723 - Cross Cultural Psychology (3)
SOP3724 - Psychology of Prejudice (3)
SOP3742 - Psychology of Women (3)
SOP3784 - Psychology of Diversity (3)
courseSection1.text4:
Other Psychology Elective
Earn at least 3 credits from the following types of courses: 
Select one additional psychology elective. 
The following courses will NOT fulfill this requirement:
INP 3141C - Advanced Applied Psychology Credit Hours: 1-3
INP 3951 - Industrial/Organizational Field Work Credit Hours: 3
PSY 3905 - Directed Independent Study Credit Hours: 1
PSY 4906 - Directed Independent Study Credit Hours: 3
PSY 4912 - Directed Independent Research Credit Hours: 3
PSY 3951 - Undergraduate Field Work - may only fulfill the requirement with prior approval.

li.Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study: Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.

courseSection0.text:
Total Undergraduate Credit Hours Required: 25

Other Requirements

Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.
